definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: The soldiers charged their guns and prepared to fire.
sentences.chinese: 兵士们将子弹装入枪膛准备射击。

sentences.english: This rifle can chamber short or long cartridges.
sentences.chinese: 这种来复枪的枪膛可以装短弹或长弹。

sentences.english: If you finish, you may  unload and show clear.
sentences.chinese: 如你已完成射击，可退出弹匣及展示已退弹之空枪膛。

sentences.english: Xu Erzhu unceasingly to the bullets in the gun barrel, until used up.
sentences.chinese: 许二柱不断往枪膛里上着子弹，直到用光。

sentences.english: Cartridges are ejected from the gun after firing.
sentences.chinese: 开枪后子弹从枪膛里弹出去。

sentences.english: He looked to the priming of his gun.
sentences.chinese: 他检查了一下他枪膛里的火药。

sentences.english: If you finish, you may unload and show clear.
sentences.chinese: 如你已实现射击，可退出弹匣及展示已退弹之空枪膛。

definition: rifling (helical grooves inside the barrel of a gun)
roof of the mouth/to load (a gun)
rifling (spiral lines on inside of gun barrel imparting spin to the bullet)
